intro: Trichocline polymorpha, commonly known as the variable trichocline, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Trichocline polymorpha is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions, which contributes to its widespread distribution.
